intro: Herniaria regnieri, commonly known as the rock scurfpea, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or limestone areas. Its leaves are usually succulent and covered in a dense layer of fine, whitish hairs. Herniaria regnieri is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and hardiness.
